subject: Data
title: The Database Administrator: Guardian of Data
description: One-minute skill: The Database Administrator: Guardian of Data.

hook.text: At 2 AM, a database runs out of disk space. The company's website goes down. One person gets the phone call.

buildup.text: Database administrators (DBAs) manage, tune, secure, and back up an organization's most critical data systems.

discovery.text: They optimize queries, plan storage capacity, manage access permissions, and execute disaster recovery plans.

twist.text: Cloud databases are automating much of the DBA role â€” but the most complex problems still require human expertise.

climax.text: A great DBA is invisible when things work and indispensable when things break.

punchline.text: Behind every reliable database is a DBA who didn't sleep well.

quiz.question: What is a database administrator's primary responsibility?
options: Managing, tuning, securing, and backing up databases
